intro: Argophyllum nitidum var. nullumense, commonly known as the Nullumense argophyllum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on slender peduncles. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
